name: Bard/CoT? I'm amazed this thread os still going on
author: Boxcrab

posts.author: Boxcrab
posts.content:
Hello! I'm trying a build setup wich I will present a more detailed blueprint lateral on, but would love to see some foreign insight, it's for a RP server, capped at 10 or 15 (depends on the time played), with a Minimum of 3 levels for each class.

1) PvM or PvP - some people don't carrera about PvP, I really don't neither, but others do and are alloud to confront you, very awkward. I'll say that, if it's good for PvP It should be good for PvM xD

2) Level cap - 10 or 15

3) Race preference - Any

4) Class preference - Bard or Paladín. CoT would be nice but Rapier Focus can harm a paladin aproximation since only one god allows it un a forgottem realm setup (neutral good).

5) Melee preference - Shield, rapier and high AC.

6) Range preference - DEX archery or Zen Archery (WIS)

7) Weapon preference - Rapier!

8) Maximum item enhancement - I would say that armor bonus is +4 top, weapon +3, +2 for elemental 1d4/1d6 aproximations.

9) Spellcasting - Not necesary, but wands and scrolls hace their relevance. Improcedencia invisibility wands are a thing that can be crafted by mates.

10) Custom factors - It's a PW RP server, so munchkin setups aren't good unless you want to stay at 10. You have some custom feats, dash for a quick sprint with bonus attack, knockdown is free, like feint, works with STR and you can get improved versión. And expertise goes Up ti -+5 with improved being -+10, depends on your AB and what you want to set It up with

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
It seems to me that the best solution would be straight Paladin(15), because of the buffs that cap at (+5) exactly at that level. I don't understand PW's with that many restrictions but it's up to you. Start with Str15 (18) Dex(8) Con(12) Int(10) Wis(14) Cha(16). Feats are WF: Rapier, IC: Rapier, Power Attack, Divine Might, Divine Shield, Blind-Fighting, Extend Spell. This should rock in a low-magic, low-level world.

Good luck,

posts.author: Boxcrab
posts.content:
Hi! Thanks for such a short reply.

Wouldn't It be simply suboptimal for saving throws compared with multiclassing and facing wizards por clerics?

Going for STR, and being the choice of picking Rapier, isn't It simply verter going for Long Sword?

Also... Isn't divine might not worth it since you aren't focusing on charisma? (Compared for example vs a feat like improved critical, wich never expires)

Asking purely for a healthy disscussion :)

PD: Any other advice for that cap?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You already have improved critical for your rapier (IC) listed on the recommended feats to take.

Your charisma is fine at 16. Paladins have two spells that they stack to raise this to 24 and then with a single (+4 charisma) item you max-out at 28. This will allow you to do +9 damage with divine might and have +9 AC with divine shield. The duration would be 9 rounds for each use of your abilities. Getting your charisma to 28 will also give you a great (+9 to all saves) boost to your saving throws. Other classes might have trouble maxing out their main attribute scores in such a low magic-world but Paladin's do not. I have played myself in low-magic worlds and have seen with my own eyes Paladins there, they were on another level so to speak in terms of abilities (also arcane archer-rogues) and power.

With your Paladin, the best choice for you is to take an elemental rapier (1d6 elemental damage, +2 enchantment) and then cast Greater magic-weapon on it. You will now have a +5 rapier with 1d6 elemental damage! Next, cast Divine-favour on you and finally Divine-might, you will suddenly hit like the express-train with your rapier inflicting 60-70 damage with each critical hit to your opponents! And if you find a keen rapier you will be able to crit from 12-20. You will have to play him right though, Paladins do require a certain minimum level of knowledge to get the most out of them.

Other good advice for 15th level capped Pw's include Fighter(8)/Weapon-master(7). This is the simplest option, you go and whack hard with your weapon, that's all it does, but it does it superbly. Get a two-handed Axe for this and see the criticals get to three-digit numbers. It doesn't have the same amount of defences as the Paladin has though. A Cleric 15th level would also be very good. but he is slightly more complicated to use (more buffing) than Paladins are.
